A0: a French multinational oil and gas company
RelatedSentence: The company has its head office in the Tour Total in the La Défense district in Courbevoie , West of Paris .

The company was founded after World War I after the French Prime Minister Raymond Poincaré rejected the idea of forming a partnership with Royal Dutch Shell in favour of creating an entirely French oil company .

At Poincaré 's behest , Col. Ernest Mercier enlisted the support of ninety banks and companies to found Total on 28 March 1924 , as the Compagnie française des pétroles ( CFP ) , literally the French Petroleum Company .

CFP took up the 23.75 % share of Deutsche Bank in the Turkish Petroleum Company ( renamed the Iraq Petroleum Company ) , awarded to France as compensation for war damages caused by Germany during World War I by the San Remo conference .
